description.narrative: To increase awareness on gender equality, to enable cultural change regarding this topic and to enhance gender inclusiveness, FMO is organising a one-week Female Leadership Journey in May 2017 for ABG and FMO employees, stakeholders and DFI colleagues. The journey will focus on female leadership development in Ghana with the objective to further advance Access Bank Ghana’s value proposition for the women’s market and at the same time further advance female leadership within the participating organizations by facilitating a dialogue between the female participants about what hinders, engages and inspires them. The program will be led, in close collaboration with FMO, by a facilitator (Better Future) with extensive experience in coaching female executives and shall make use of peer to peer learning and be organized in a highly participatory manner. Other participants will include at least one DFI (Swedfund) and at least one representative of the Dutch Government. Consultancy partners, Enclude and KIT are also likely to attend.
